intro: Anisopappus buchwaldii subsp. iodotrichus, commonly known as the iodotrichus subshrub, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has hairy leaves and is adapted to arid and rocky environments. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with composite flower heads. This subspecies is notable for its unique leaf structure and ecological role in its native habitat.
